content: Stadium in Singapore **Serangoon Stadium** is a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) in [Serangoon](/wiki/Serangoon), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It is located at 33 Yio Chu Kang Road, Singapore 545677. It has a seating capacity of 1,200. [*citation needed*] It was built in 1993 and opened to the public on 1 March 1994. [*citation needed*] The stadium is open to the public for recreational activities. Many events had been organized in the stadium since its opening. ## History In 2015, the [Football Association of Singapore](/wiki/Football_Association_of_Singapore) opened its third Grassroots Football Training Centre at Serangoon Stadium. ## Major events One of the recent most important event is the Workers' Party (WP) rallies that were held in the (/wiki/2006_Singaporean_general_election), (/wiki/2011_Singaporean_general_election), and [2015 general elections](/wiki/2015_Singaporean_general_election) for the Aljunied GRC constituency. 1°21′22″N 103°52′30″E﻿ / ﻿1.356202°N 103.874947°E﻿ / 1.356202; 103.874947 This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Serangoon Stadium
